editorialSummary.text: American fare, drag-queen shows & a cabaret atmosphere make up this long-running NYC experience.

originalText.text: I was taken to Lucky Cheng’s to celebrate my birthday and finishing my doctorate #FinishEdD and I HAD AN AMAZING TIME!!! Lola & Prima #Slayed The performances were sooooooo fun!!! The drinks were flowing and the crowd participation made the show so much more enjoyable. A great time. I definitely recommend going and having a great time.

text.text: I was taken to Lucky Cheng’s to celebrate my birthday and finishing my doctorate #FinishEdD and I HAD AN AMAZING TIME!!! Lola & Prima #Slayed The performances were sooooooo fun!!! The drinks were flowing and the crowd participation made the show so much more enjoyable. A great time. I definitely recommend going and having a great time.

originalText.text: The best show I've ever seen. Professional , fun, unique. Performer doesn 't just open her mouth to someone else 's music and raise money like all performers in New York, but she also has an idea in her performance .

text.text: The best show I've ever seen. Professional , fun, unique. Performer doesn 't just open her mouth to someone else 's music and raise money like all performers in New York, but she also has an idea in her performance .

originalText.text: Technical novelties , robotic costumes, classic and futuristic performances. In a word , magic . After the Show , we had a great mood all day . My next trip to New York will definitely go through this cabaret.

text.text: Technical novelties , robotic costumes, classic and futuristic performances. In a word , magic . After the Show , we had a great mood all day . My next trip to New York will definitely go through this cabaret.

originalText.text:
My friends and I went to Lucky Cheng’s for bday celebration.
It was INCREDIBLE. I’ve never laughed so much. Show was incredible. So much work and so much creativity.
The energy of the brunch is so light and happy.

It’s a true gem of New York entertainment. Strongly recommend.

text.text:
My friends and I went to Lucky Cheng’s for bday celebration.
It was INCREDIBLE. I’ve never laughed so much. Show was incredible. So much work and so much creativity.
The energy of the brunch is so light and happy.

It’s a true gem of New York entertainment. Strongly recommend.

originalText.text:
We had a great time at drag brunch celebrating a family birthday. We were a small party and even though we were seated at the back row, we didn’t miss a beat.
The fabulous queens come around each and every table, so don’t forget your $$ singles for tipping. There is no bad seat here. The mimosas were indeed bottomless. Every time I turned around my glass was full. Our server, Gretchen, was fun and overall she has the most AMAZING act of the show IMO. Lola and Aria were very engaging hosts and wonderful performers!

The food is OK. Portions are pretty good. The apps were better than the entrees. Highly recommend the pu pu platter and spring rolls. We also had the nachos which were a little soggy, and the chicken and waffles: chicken was hard but waffles not bad. The burger was the best of the entrees. We didn’t go here for the food so in that respect, it met our expectations and was good snacking while we enjoyed our bottomless mimosas.

The show was very entertaining. I don’t remember the name of the queen that did the number with the Barbie dolls but that was off the hook! Great time was had by all. Will definitely go again when I get the chance.
